othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Map individual fields between Dynamics 365 and Power so corresponding data points stay synchronized across systems.

li.p: From the left panel under Groups, select Map Fields.
li.stepresult: The Map Fields page is displayed.

li.p: From the ribbon at the top of the page, click New.
li.stepresult: The New Map Field page is displayed.

li.p: Enter the Name of the custom entity that holds the mapped field data (for example, "Account").
Enter the Display Name that is shown to the user in the UI.
Enter the Type, that is, for the fields being mapped (for example, "Lookup"). The name of the field type must be the same between Dynamics 365 and Power.
Enter the Dynamics Field Name (API name). For example, "apttus_accountid."

note.p: To avoid errors, copy-and-paste the field name from Dynamics 365.

li.p: Enter the Power Field Name (API name). For example, "Apttus__Account__c".

note.p: To avoid errors, copy-and-paste the field name from Power.

li.p: Search and select the Object Mapping Name. This is the mapping name of the field's object (for example "clm_agreement Mapping").
Lookup field only: Skip this step if the field is not Lookup. Search and select Reference Object Mapping Name. This is the mapping name of the parent object (for example "clm_account Mapping").

SelectOption field only: Skip this step If the field is not SelectOption (picklist). Search and select the Select Option Set Id. This is the name of the Select Option Set mapping that holds the picklist values (refer to Mapping Picklist Field Values for steps to create a Select Option Set).
Repeat steps 2 â€“ 10 for each field you want to map for the specified object.
